result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James J Ware

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James J Ware not in court.  Attorney Fred Richardson III appeared by video for James J Ware.  Attorney Olivia Simmons in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued. Court further orders that bail is forfeited. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant James J Ware appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness present prior to the case being called. The witness was released due to the defendant not being connected to audio for over 2 hours. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  
Defendant to have no contact with *JP, 1710 W Mitchell Street.
Court Reinstated Justice Point Supervision to Level 3 and other conditions of bail previously ordered remain in place.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James J Ware appeared by video, in custody.  
Attorney Fred Richardson III appeared by video for James J Ware.  
Attorney William R. F. Ackell in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Matter before the Court for Bench Warrant Return.  
Defense counsel provides explanation of defendant's non appearance.
Court sets cash TOT Justice Point with same previous conditions of release. 
Court ordered case adjourned for a  Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Court. Defendant waives Time Limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADJOURNED OFF THE RECORD. 
Case calendared for a Return on Warrant. Defendant in custody.  
Per email correspondence defense counsel is in trial and unavailable.
new date confirmed with defense counsel. Return on Warrant scheduled September 9, 2022 at 9:00am.

Bench Warrant Cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on  8-30-2022.
Original  bench warrant scanned. Case is adjourned for  Return of Bench Warrant in Branch 19.
Hearing date confirmed with defense counsel via email. State notified.  Return of Warrant scheduled September 8, 2022 at 2:30pm.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($1,000.00 signature bond) LW
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 1000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Fred Richardson in court by video.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.
No contact order signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JP, or 710 West Mitchell Street, in the City of Milwaukee, Milwaukee County, Wisconsin

Defendant James J Ware in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant James J Ware in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  James J Ware appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
